intro: Cyrtandra cupulata var. cupulata, commonly known as the Hawaiian crown flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, while its stems are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
